Lesson
objectives

Describe segmentation

Describe how assignment works

When we set up our insurance business,
we needed a way to classify claims in order
to manage them effectively. Complex
claims take more effort than simple claims.
Those claims need to be given to
experienced adjusters with more
specialized skills.

+ Based on group type,
+ Based on group region

Next, objects are assigned to a user within that group

Example
+ Assign claim with segment “wc_med_pay” to geographically appropriate “medical payments” group
+ Assign the claim to an adjuster in the “medical payments” group

* ClaimCenter validates the claim after SAW
¢ Validation is based on configurable rules and data requirements

¢ Results in a validation level being assigned to the claim

| Claim and exposure maturity (1 of 5) Gi

Validation
level

¢ Validation levels measure the maturity level of claims and exposures

¢ Every level has a series of conditions that must be met in order to reach that level
¢ Validation levels are configurable

¢ Lowest level is New Loss Completion

¢ Highest level is Ability to Pay

| Claim and exposure maturity (2 of 5)

Load save

¢ Load save is used only for claims from external systems or portals
¢ There is not enough information to process these draft claims

* Once further information is added, the claim can move up in maturity

| Claim and exposure maturity (3 of 5) Gi

totems fap

¢ All required data must be supplied before a user can create a claim with the New
Claim Wizard

¢ The New Claim Wizard enforces this requirement

¢ This is part of the validation process

| Claim and exposure maturity (4 of 5)

¢ ClaimCenter provides intermediate maturity levels
¢ Intermediate levels are configurable (may be modified, added, or deleted)

¢ Base configuration includes:
+ Valid for ISO

+ Send to external

Claim and exposure maturity (5 of 5)

ic <

¢ Ability to Pay validates that all required data for payment is on the claim or
exposure

¢ Ability to Pay is the highest maturity level
¢ The claim must reach Ability to Pay before any exposure can be paid

* Each exposure must reach Ability to Pay before the exposure can be paid

The maturing claim/exposure (1 of 2)

and the user is told which conditions the object does not yet meet

The maturing claim/exposure (2 of 2)

a

¢ ClaimCenter automatically promotes it to the highest level it satisfies

¢ ClaimCenter prevents changes that would force an object to backslide
